README:
The MG/ME Pythia-PGS package
By Johan Alwall and the CP3 development team

http://madgraph.phys.ucl.ac.be/
http://madgraph.hep.uiuc.edu/
http://madgraph.roma2.infn.it/

To set Fortran compiler, and Mac OS X version specific flags:
-------------------------------------------------------------
Edit the file src/make_opts.
Note that this is done automatically if run from within the mg5 interface
using "install pythia-pgs".
Please see the file README.macosx for troubleshooting.

To run Pythia on an event file:
-------------------------------
Please note that if there is a pythia_card.dat and the pythia-pgs
package is installed in the default location (see item 1 below),
pythia will be run automatically when you generate events with MadEvent.

1) Make sure the pythia-pgs package is unpacked in the MG_ME_v4.x.x
   directory

2) Do "make" in the pythia-pgs/ directory

3) Go to the MyProcDir  directory and run 
   ./bin/madevent pythia RUNNAME
   and follow instructions

To run PGS on a STDHEP file:
----------------------------

Follow the steps above, with "pythia" replaced by "pgs"
README.macosx:
Author: Johan Alwall
E-mail: alwall@fnal.gov

Troubleshooting for Mac OS X
============================

1. If compilation fails with the following error message:

make[3]: *** [stdhep] Error 2
make[2]: *** [lib/libstdhep.a] Error 2
make[1]: *** [../libraries/PGS4/examples/olympics] Error 2
make: *** [all] Error 2

this usually means that there is a mismatch between the number of bits
in the computer architecture and the compiler. Please change the MBITS
variable in src/make_opts from 64 to 32 or vice versa. Then run 

make clean
make

2. If compilation fails with the linker not finding some subroutines,
please add

DARWINLIBS=-lSystemStubs 

in the src/make_opts file, and run "make clean; make".

3. If there are some other compilation problems that are not taken
care of by the above fixes, please report this at
https://bugs.launchpad.net/pythia-pgs-for-mg/+filebug
